description.narrative: By 2022, national and provincial government mechanisms are strengthened to legislate, plan, coordinate and budget for gender- responsive and safely managed water and sanitation facilities in development and humanitarian situations.

sector.narrative: WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)

title.narrative: Pakistan United Nations Development Assistance Framework
"Pakistan Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Water Sanitation and Hygiene)
UNICEF Programmes in Pakistan (Emergencies Disaster Risk Reduction)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2018 Pakistan: Evaluation of Joint P&DD and UNICEF Country-Led Evaluation of the Clean Drinking Water for All (CDWA) Project Balochistan
2019 Pakistan: Reach Every District (RED)/Reach Every Community (REC) Strategy Evaluation Pakistan (2014-18)
Pakistan 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Pakistan Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, national and provincial government mechanisms are strengthened to legislate, plan, coordinate and budget for gender- responsive and safely managed water and sanitation facilities in development and humanitarian situations.

description.narrative: UNICEF advocacy and technical support to the government led to an increased allocation of public funds towards WASH in the 2019–2020 budget announcement. The published Joint Sector Review recommendations and improvement in policies and institutional arrangements for implementation and regulation at all levels is bringing special attention to meeting the needs of women and girls and those in vulnerable situations with equitable WASH services. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Water, sanitation and hygiene sector plans integrating climate resilient development and/or risk management strategies available

baseline.value: 1) Balochistan Drinking Water Policy and Strategy (approved) and Balochistan Sanitation Policy and Strategy (drafted) and WASH Sector Development Plan (drafted) has integrated climate resilient strategies 2) FATA 3 (Water, Sanitation & BCC strategies are in place but not aligned to SDGs) WASH Sector Plan is not in place 3) KP 3 (Water, Sanitation & BCC strategies are in place but not aligned to SDGs) (WASH Sector Plan is not in place) 4) Punjab Punjab Water Policy, Punjab Sanitation Policy

target.value: 2022:1)Balochistan Support GoB for operationalization of WASH Sector Plan 2)FATA Support Government of FATA in implementation of WASH sector plan. Conduct annuals JSR to track annual progress on sector plan. 3)KP Support GoKP in implementation of WASH sector plan. Conduct annuals JSR to track annual progress on sector plan.

actual.value: 2019:Balochistan: Further analysis of the Joint Sector Review report was carried out with a focus on budget and expenditure, and a resource mobilization plan for filling the funding gap was developed. KP: KP WASH sector plan developed and submitted to secretary P&D for approval. Punjab: Punjab Water Act

title.narrative: Existence and implementation of national water, sanitation and hygiene sector policy and strategy

baseline.value: 1) Balochistan Drinking Water Policy and strategy is approved, Balochistan Sanitation Policy and strategy is drafted and Cabinet approval is being pursued. 2) FATA Water policy and Sanitation Policy are in place aligned with MDGs 3) KP Water policy approved &Sanitation Policy at draft level are in place aligned with MDGs 4) Punjab Water Policy and Punjab Sanitation Policy revised as per SDGs 5) Sindh Safe Drinking Water Policy, Sanitation Policy, WASH BCC Strategy, WASH in Schools Strategy, and

target.value: 2022:1)Balochistan Annual Joint Sector Reviews to track the progress on policies implementation. 2)FATA Annual Joint Sector Reviews to track the progress on policies implementation. 3)KP Annual Joint Sector Reviews to track the progress on policies implementation. 4)Punjab Annual JSR done 5)Sindh Progress tracking and Joint Sector Review to consolidate the work on policies implementation and increase in sector sub sector allocations

actual.value: 2019:Balochistan = Water policy operationalized, and Sanitation policy, strategy and WASH Sector Plan has been endorsed by Provincial Steering Committee submitted to Chief Minister for cabinet approval. KP = Water policy revised as per SDGs definition. Sanitation policy revision completed, submitted to

title.narrative: National standards for WASH in schools with a disability component available

baseline.value: 1) Balochistan WASH in Schools Standards are available with a disability component 2) FATA WASH in Schools Strategy (2017-2022) approved 3) KP WASH in Schools Strategy (2017-2022) approved 4) Punjab WASH in Schools Standards are available with a disability component 5) Sindh WASH in Schools Standrads are available and provincial WASH in Schools Startegy (2017-2022) approved

target.value: 2022:1)Balochistan Continued advocacy and leveraging on resources for WASH in Schools in Balochistan 2)FATA Continued advocacy and leveraging on resources for WASH in Schools in FATA 3)KP Continued advocacy and leveraging on resources for WASH in Schools in KP 4)Punjab 5)Sindh Continued advocacy and leveraging on resources for WASH in Schools in Sindh Strategy Roll out and scaling up of provision of WASH facilities in schools, UNICEF will also assist government for provision of 120 schools

actual.value: 2019:Balochistan: WinS strategy operationalized in 2019; UNICEF supported 80 schools. KP: Continued advocacy and leveraging on resources for WASH in Schools in KP. Punjab: Punjab WinS Standards rolled out in all districts and WinS included in Punjab Education Sector Plan and other strategic documents su
